questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
Choose the correct question form:
options: Did you went to the party?
Did you go to the party?
questions.answer: Did you go to the party?

questions.question: Can I play? I ___________ my homework

Choose the best word: He’s very ____ about his exam results.

What do you say when you don’t understand?

Choose the correct sentence.
options: I have visited Paris last year.

questions.question: Which word is a synonym for 'angry'?
Choose the correct form: 'If I _____ enough money, I would travel the world.'
Which sentence is in the passive voice?
options: Dinner was cooked by the chef.
questions.answer: Dinner was cooked by the chef.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the present perfect tense?
Choose the correct question form.
What is the correct preposition? 'She is afraid ___ spiders.'
Choose the correct sentence.
options: There is too much people here.
There are too much people here.
There are too many people here.
There is too many people here.
questions.answer: There are too many people here.

questions.question: Which sentence shows a first conditional?
options: If it rains, we will cancel the picnic.
If it rained, we would cancel the picnic.
If it had rained, we would have cancelled the picnic.
If it raining, we will cancel the picnic.
questions.answer: If it rains, we will cancel the picnic.

questions.question: Choose the correct phrasal verb: 'She ________ smoking last year after the diagnosis.'

The weather was so hot that I could hardly ___?

options: I used to going there every day.

questions.question: Wow, look at that guy! He's ______ handsome!
What does the phrasal verb “run out of” mean?
options: To finish the supply of something
questions.answer: To finish the supply of something

questions.question: Which is correct? “He’s really good ___ solving problems.”
Which suffix creates a noun meaning a person who does something?
Which sentence shows a contrast using “although”?
options: Although he is rich, he’s not happy.
He is rich, although he’s not happy.
He is although rich, not happy.
Although, he is rich, he not happy.
questions.answer: Although he is rich, he’s not happy.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses “enough”?
options: He is enough tall to play basketball.
He tall enough is to play basketball.
He is tall enough to play basketball.
He is enough to be tall.
questions.answer: He is tall enough to play basketball.

questions.question: What does “take after” mean?

Which is correct for expressing regret about a missed opportunity?
options: He must have gone to the party.
He will have gone to the party.
He should have gone to the party.
He could go to the party.
questions.answer: He should have gone to the party.

questions.question: I remember _________ her look uncomfortable
Which of these correctly expresses a different possible past?
options: If I study, I would pass the exam.
If I studied, I will pass the exam.
If I had studied, I would have passed the exam.
If I had studied, I will have passed the exam.
questions.answer: If I had studied, I would have passed the exam.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the past perfect correctly?
options: She has gone to the shop before it rained.
She goes to the shop before it rains.
She had gone to the shop before it rained.
She had go to the shop before it rain.
questions.answer: She had gone to the shop before it rained.

questions.question: Which dependent preposition is correct? “This book belongs ___ me.”

What does the phrasal verb “get over” mean in the context of illness?
Which of the following uses a modal perfect correctly?
options: You must gone to the shop.
She must have gone to the shop.
They should have go to the shop.
He could has gone to the shop.
questions.answer: She must have gone to the shop.

questions.question: Which sentence shows advice about the past?

options: If I had known, I would have told you.
If I know, I will tell you.
If I know, I would tell you.
If I knew, I will tell you.
questions.answer: If I had known, I would have told you.

questions.question: We need ________ this business better

options: Had you eaten lunch before class?
questions.answer: Had you eaten lunch before class?

questions.question: Which is an example of “get by”?
options: She got by with little money.
questions.answer: She got by with little money.

I wish I ______ my umbrella. It's pouring!

options: I wish I speak to her.
I wish I had spoken to her.
I wish I will speak to her.
If only I speak to her.
questions.answer: I wish I had spoken to her.

questions.question: I wish you ______ so much noise. I'm trying to focus.
